channel.title: Devices - Perfect Dark Mode
channel.description: /dev directory You can interact with device drivers through device files or device nodes, these are special files that look like regular files. You can use ls,cat, etc to interact with them. Generally stored in /dev directory $ ls /dev When you send output to /dev/null, the kernal knows that this device takes all of our input and just discards it, so nothing gets returned. Device Types $ ls -l /dev
